skill.name: architecture-diagram
skill.description: Create professional, dark-themed architecture diagrams as standalone HTML files with SVG graphics. Use when the user asks for system architecture diagrams, infrastructure diagrams, cloud architecture visualizations, security diagrams, network topology diagrams, or any technical diagram showing system components and their relationships.
skill.summary: Create professional, dark-themed architecture diagrams as standalone HTML files with SVG graphics. U...
skill.author: Cocoon-AI

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation and template-based skill with no executable code, no file system access, no network calls for data exfiltration, and no command execution capabilities. It provides design system specifications and an HTML template for generating architecture diagrams.

content.value_statement: Creating technical architecture diagrams by hand takes significant time and requires design skills. This skill provides ready-to-use HTML templates with a consistent dark theme, semantic colors, and SVG graphics that render correctly in any browser.
actual_capabilities: Generate self-contained HTML files with inline SVG architecture diagrams
Apply consistent dark theme styling with semantic color coding for component types
Create component boxes for frontend, backend, database, cloud, and security elements
Draw connection arrows with labels between system components
Add security groups, region boundaries, and message bus elements
Include summary cards and legends in diagram output
limitations: Does not import existing diagrams or parse code to auto-generate architecture
Does not support interactive or animated diagram elements beyond CSS animations
Requires manual specification of all components and their positions
Output is HTML only - no export to PNG, SVG, or other image formats

use_cases.title: Document system designs
use_cases.description: Create professional diagrams for system design documents, architecture review presentations, and technical specifications

use_cases.title: Map infrastructure
use_cases.description: Visualize cloud infrastructure, network topology, and deployment architectures for AWS, Azure, or GCP environments

use_cases.title: Design security diagrams
use_cases.description: Document security boundaries, auth flows, and compliance architectures with security-specific visual elements

prompt_templates.title: Basic architecture
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a simple three-tier web application diagram
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an architecture diagram for a three-tier web application with a React frontend, Node.js API backend, and PostgreSQL database. Use the architecture-diagram skill with the dark theme template.

prompt_templates.title: Cloud infrastructure
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an AWS architecture diagram showing CloudFront CDN, API Gateway, Lambda functions, DynamoDB, and S3 buckets in us-west-2 region. Include security groups and IAM roles.

prompt_templates.title: Microservices system
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a microservices architecture diagram with multiple backend services communicating via Kafka message bus. Include auth service, user service, payment service, and notification service.

prompt_templates.title: Security architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a security architecture diagram showing zero-trust model with identity provider, mutual TLS between services, encryption at rest, and security group boundaries. Use rose color for security elements.

output_examples.input: Create an architecture diagram for a web application with React frontend, Express API, PostgreSQL database, and Redis cache behind a load balancer.
output: Self-contained HTML file with dark-themed architecture diagram
Frontend component in cyan with React label
Load balancer and backend components in appropriate colors
Database and cache components with PostgreSQL and Redis labels
Connection arrows showing HTTPS and database communication flows
Summary cards describing key system components

best_practices: Group related components within security groups or region boundaries for visual clarity
Use consistent color coding across all diagrams for the same component types
Place legends outside boundary boxes and extend viewBox height to accommodate them
anti_patterns: Overlapping component boxes without adequate vertical spacing between them
Placing legends inside region or cluster boundaries where they become obscured
Drawing connection arrows after component boxes, causing arrows to appear on top of fills

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is compatible with any AI assistant that can follow the SKILL.md specifications.

faq.question: What file formats does the output support?
faq.answer: The skill generates standalone HTML files. Open them directly in any browser to view, print to PDF, or take screenshots for other formats.

faq.question: Can I use the diagrams offline?
faq.answer: Yes. Diagrams are self-contained HTML with inline SVG. They work without internet except for the Google Fonts CDN link.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill generates static HTML only. No data is sent anywhere. All processing happens locally when you render the HTML file.

faq.question: Why do my diagrams look different?
faq.answer: Check that you are using the architecture-diagram skill correctly and that the dark theme CSS is properly included in the HTML output.

faq.question: How is this different from Mermaid or PlantUML?
faq.answer: This skill generates professional dark-themed HTML diagrams with precise control over visual styling. Mermaid and PlantUML generate different output formats and may require additional rendering tools.
